intro: Holosteum breistrofferi, commonly known as the mountain holosteum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible roots. The plant features upright, branched stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. Its small, white to pale pink flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The species is characterized by its adaptability to high-altitude environments and its role in local ecosystems.
